Topic.Title: Intc. New chips mobile and tablet

Message.Msg: OoO was probably possible at 32nm but 22nm makes it painless. realworldtechDOTcom/silvermont/8/ "Intel claims that the core and system level microarchitectural improvements will yield 50% higher IPC for Silvermont versus the previous generation. Comparing the two microarchitectures in Figure 7, that is a highly plausible claim as out-of-order scheduling alone should be worth 30% and perhaps 5-10% for better branch prediction. Additionally, the 22nm process technology has reduced Vmin by around 100mV, and increased clock frequencies by roughly 20-30%. In total, this paints a very attractive picture for Silvermont. To cement this view, Intel compared Silvermont to Saltwell for tablets, showing performance data suggesting a 2× increase in CPU performance at constant power or a 5× reduction in power. Intel also claims a 60% performance and 3× power over projections for competing 28nm tablet SoCs expected later this year. In the more abstract realm of CPU to CPU comparisons, Intel indicated that Silvermont is a much faster design than the Cortex A7 or the A15 at any given power level; the goal is to avoid any complicated and high latency software-driven power management and rely on firmware-based management and power gating. As a design point, this is a good choice and follows in the steps of Apple’s Swift or Qualcomm’s Krait, which are undeniably successful CPU cores. " p.s. remember that to accommodate the traditional x86 CISC power handicap Silvermont is still a 2-way issue processor like A9 but not like A15, S600/S800, Swift. However the performance of those CISC commands boosted by macro-fusion of these commands allows the performance not to suffer against a 3-way ARM device. Intel has made the right performance/power tradeoffs at the right process size something that cannot be said about ARM A15 at 28-32nm which is too power intensive to be used flat out in a phone.

Topic.Title: Bear Raid?

Message.Msg: I certainly think so. Think about it...with the amount of stock and options short, what would YOU do if you were they? You'd come in with both barrels blazing and TRY to scare ALL the weak hands out of the stock prior to earnings. This kind of action will be interpreted by many average shareholders as if someone KNOWS something negative is coming, Thursday. Add to that a negative article by Schaeffer's Research, saying that NVDA has done poorly quite often right after earnings and the put buying has been large...And, in my humble opinion, those people are once again looking backward and not forward. Of course, they could be right, and I'll suffer financially in the short term, but I'm using THIS nonsense to ADD to my calls in Jan '14. I would think both the company and some of the large PMs are buying at this level. As always, we'll know in the fullness of time. Best, Max

Topic.Title: Jen was so happy that he was "THRILLED" to work on the PS3 and now what? lol

Message.Msg: No XC. the answer is no. PS3 came out how long ago? So many things have changed since PS3 came out. Mobile was not what it is today. PC's were still good and Tablets were not that popular yet. Pretty much all the things that are going to DESTROY the consoles from here on out were not part of the picture yet. Jen is simply changing with the times. At that time PS3 was a great opportunity, but if you fall in love with old technology you die along with it (the PC is a perfect example of how being tied to old dieing technology is bad). Jen realizes that consoles are ultimately not the future and maybe learned his lesson not to count on old tech to power future growth. Is the PS4 a good opportunity? ABSOLUTELY, but its not a game changer and its not revolutionary in any way.

Message.Title: Xiaomi Mi4 to be shipped with Tegra 5 Logan SoC
Message.Msg: Monday, 6 May 2013 NVIDIA Tegra 5 Logan What we expected already turns out to be anonymously confirmed from inside Xiaomi R&D: The Xiaomi Mi4 will be released with the latest NVIDIA Tegra 5 (code-named Logan) SoC. The Xiaomi Mi-4 will be shipped for the China Telecom market with the next generation Tegra 5 Logan, which will have a CPU processor power of 2.4 GHz and an internal memory of 4 to 8 GB. Both the Xiaomi Mi4 and the Tegra 5 Logan SoC will be released after the first quarter of 2014. PS: Logan Tegra 5 will be the first SoC incorporating a true Kepler GPU core with unified shaders, programmable and supports CUDA.

Topic.Title: Xiaomi Mi4 to be shipped with Tegra 5 Logan SoC
